intro: Sebastiania cornuta, commonly known as the horned sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, reddish stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, green fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, orange aril. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
